WRITING.TEXT: Our urgent care has a flushing machine and used it to clear impacted wax out of my fiancs ear, it's worth a shot to ask if there's anything they can even do for you.

I have paroxysmal tachycardia, but mine lasts a little longer than 30 seconds and freaks me out too bad to feel euphoric. I've been on countless heart monitors, had xrays, blood work, EKGs, and they can't figure it out either. But I'm being tested for further thyroid, autoimmune, metabolic, and adrenal disorders so my problem may lie there. I'd suggest asking your GP to test your thyroid, adrenal function, etc. and if it becomes to bothersome, maybe talk to them about a beta-blocker to help with the attacks and pain. It's not something to rely on long-term, but it may help until you figure it out. Best of luck!

IANAD, but with a history of a heart condition, I'd say this warrants a trip to the ER or wherever to get checked out, since you're having chest pains. Don't worry whether you're going to bother your parents or not. They're your parents and if you're sick, you can't help it. Better to be safe than sorry. I know nothing about a temperature reading like that, though. I hope you feel better.
Just this past Friday, I had a meltdown and punched the shit out of my thigh. Bruises galore. It looks awful. But I can't control it.

WRITING.TITLE: Question about Cort stim test.
WRITING.TEXT: Hello everyone, In the next couple of weeks I will be undergoing tests for adrenal insufficiency/fatigue, metabolic disorders, and a few others I know plenty about. But I was wondering if anyone could give me some insight on what to expect from the Cort stim test. I've done my reading on it but I'd like to know anyones experience in having it done. I'm incredibly anxious as is and would like to know what to expect. Thank you for your time! Info: 23 years old, 5'6", 110lbs. Current meds: Omeperazole magnesium, propranolol, depo-provera shot, promethazine. Existing conditions: Thyroid disoder, paroxysmal tachycardia, endometriosis, IBS, asthma.

I'm from Ohio, it's pop here too, haha. I quit drinking soda over a year and a half ago and lost quite a bit of weight, it really does help cutting it out. But I'm glad it's working for you! It's so hard to find the right med a lot of the time and you end up getting burnt out on switching to this and that, then adding this to that and etc.

Thank you so much for your reply :) I've had one small psychotic break but its like...its inevitable. Whether it be five or ten, maybe twenty years from now, I know one day I'm truly going to snap and I just don't know what I'll do or how bad it will be. The lack of sleep thing makes sense, though. Usually when I pull that crap, I'm really manic and don't sleep for days and I just clean, organize, rearrange my house, buy shit I don't need, buy a bunch of food and make it but don't eat a single bite...then by the time I come down, I hit hard. I can't bring myself to get out of bed or eat, I don't shower or brush my hair or teeth for weeks at a time, I don't leave my house, and its just bad news. I eventually come out of it but damn, its a fucking roller coaster and each time becomes worse.

I just don't want to walk around all zombified and emotionless. I'm underweight so that's what the Remeron is for, I guess it's an appetite stimulant so I can't complain about weight gain. But I've had horrible acne for years, nothing helps it so I just deal with it. I know those side effects are what bother people the most but I hate the grogginess and not feeling like I can concentrate or function. It freaks me out. I am incredibly grateful for communities like these. Yeah we're all strangers, but shit, we're fighting the same battle. I still don't think someone can truly understand mental illness until they have experienced it themselves.

Depakote made me gain weight like crazy and even more moody than I already was. I hated that shit. My dreams have always been vivid and violent, even while not medicated so I can't say it affected me in that regard. If it makes you feel weird or you can't handle it, talk to your pdoc :) There's so many other medications and sometimes you just have to find the one thats a perfect fit for you.
Female - bipolar 1

Thank you for your reply, it made me smile :) It's just so hard to deal with when everything is thrown at you all at once and I worry too much about all of the 'what ifs' and never expect any good outcomes, so I'm working on that. But I'm just worried about all the new meds and how they're going to affect me. I've heard nothing but good things about Remeron but Lamictal and Abilify are a whole different story lol

WRITING.TITLE: Having a hard time.
WRITING.TEXT: This is my first post here, so please bear with me. I was diagnosed with bipolar I and anxiety disorder when I was 13, but I had been dealing with it for years before being diagnosed. I've had one hospital stay, after my second manic episode in which I ended up trying to hang myself, when I was 14. I had been on lithium and depakote when I was admitted and during my stay I was overdosed on lithium and became very ill, so I refused it from there on out. I was put on Trileptal and stayed on it until last year. I quit taking it after a nervous breakdown and health crisis and have been unmedicated since. Fast forward to present day, I'm 23 and I've had multiple bouts of full blown and mania and depression, I've developed an eating disorder, suffer from extreme emetophobia, and after my visit today, I was told my pdoc believes in showing signs of schizoaffective disorder, due to hearing voices, hallucinations, antisocial behavior, not taking care of myself for long periods of time, and paranoid delusions. I have actually had these symptoms for years now, but just thought it came with the bipolar disorder so I never brought it up until asked today. I feel crazy. Now that I'm looking back on everything, yes, it does fit and make sense, but that doesn't mean it doesn't suck. So, I'm being started on Remeron for the anorexia, Lamictal for the bipolar disorder, and Abilify for possible schizoaffevtive disorder. These are a lot of new drugs to try after not having taken any for over a year and I'm terrified honestly. I don't know how they're going to affect me and I'm really sensitive to medicine as is. Plus, on top of everything, it's just hard dealing with the fact this might be true, like, how the fuck do I explain to friends and loved ones I'm schizoaffrective, bipolar, anorexic, and anxiety ridden without being treated like a basket case in the end? I'm just lost and scared. Everything is finally starting to make sense but I'm worried what the future holds. The voices, hallucinations, and paranoid delusions have gotten worse in the past few months and what happens when it all boils over and I have a psychotic break or something? I'm just gonna go back to bed and hope I'm not as depressed when I wake up and can hopefully get a better handle on the situation. I really hope these meds help me. I'm going to have a massive panic attack about taking them but I have no choice anymore. Thank you for listening, I just really needed to get this off my chest to someone or people who actually understand what it's like.
I will cry tears of joy if someone can help this poor baby. OP, at least you have a heart. I really hope something comes of people sharing this post.

Apple juice works for me when I don't want to take a laxative or anything. I always chug a glass or so of it and it soon works its magic. Congrats on quitting smoking though! I wish I had that willpower right now but I just can't get myself to quit.

I've never heard of anyone v*ing from even eating mold. I ate a moldy cookie once and was absolutely fine, after I freaked out of course but nothing at all happened. You're going to be okay, I promise. Eat something if you're hungry, don't deprive yourself :)

Ah crap, that's true :/ It would have defeated the purpose at that point. But I've honestly done the same exact thing. Years ago, I actually did do it. Wanna know the f*cked up part? My gag reflex is pretty much non-existent and I couldn't even get myself to gag. So it was pointless. I even chugged mountain dew and ate a handful of oreos to make it happen and it wouldn't. So I was just sick and miserable for a day and a half. But I've heard of people kind of getting over emetophobia by doing that, so if anyone ever has enough courage to do it, more power to them!

This comment made me chuckle cause I've wondered the same thing sometimes. It freaking amazes me that you can take a sip of water and two minutes later it's like it went right through you. I'm so sorry you're dealing with this crap, I really hope these antibiotics and steroids do help.

Blech, steroids are prone to messing with your stomach too. My mom has issues with them every time she takes them so I can imagine mixing them with an antibiotic doesn't make it any easier :/ But like you said, your boyfriend felt the same way but never v*, so if you made it through that wave of nausea, you can handle anything. You did awesome though! Just put yourself in that mindset if it happens again and I know you'll get through it, whether it happens or not.
Did you happen to eat before you took it?
How are you doing? It sounds like you've got a grip on this thing at the moment and that's awesome. Let us know how everything goes for you! I hope you feel better soon.

This actually happens to me every once in a while. I wake up in my own bed, in my own house, and do not know where I am or don't know who is in bed with me (I've been with my fianc for 8 years so it's obviously always him) and freak out until I fully come to and realize it wasn't real. I noticed it happens when I go to sleep overly tired, stressed out, or not feeling well. I never looked too much into it cause friends have mentioned it happening to them as well. I wouldn't worry too much :)
Benadryl may help, too. I'm also not a doctor.

Might want to be checked for kidney stones. Wouldn't explain the migraine, but all of your other symptoms could be caused by a kidney stone. I only suggest it cause I regularly get kidney stones and they are killer.

I was told by my pdoc that the lamictal rash usually occurs around the face and mouth area and hands and arms first. She told me to be suspicious of any rash at all and to be checked out at once if I developed one. Better to be safe than sorry. Just because one person doesn't have a reaction, doesn't mean others won't. I was told the rash is a medical emergency.

It's okay, I understand. My night has been pretty shitty and I've gone off on every person who has engaged me today so I feel you. Plus, it's hard to really interpret through a random post or text what kind of attitude someone has. I've honestly never been told anything about steroids and hormones having an effect on people with bipolar disorder, which kind of makes me mad cause I feel it should have been brought up or mentioned at one point in the last 15 years I've been treated for stuff. I've been on the depo-provera shot for 8 years now and haven't had any issues with it, thank god. But I was recently prescribed a round of steroids for a cold that aggravated my asthma but I never took them. It just intrigued me cause I never thought steroids could have an impact on bipolar disorder and wondered the chemistry of it or maybe why it happens. I like to be knowledgeable about stuff cause I've had so many medications affect me in such weird ways and I'm left in the dark as to why or why I was never warned. I'm going to ask my pdoc about this on Thursday when I see her, I wonder what she knows about it, or if there are any other meds I should be cautious of.

I didn't have a shitty attitude, I legitimately wondered because I have never heard of it and its nice learning new things that may help me in the future. I absolutely was not shitty with you or doubting you, I was wondering the effect you were speaking of cause I was curious. I have never had to take steroids so it isn't something I was warned about or told of. Sorry for asking.
Steroids can interfere with bipolar disorder? How so? In all my years I've never heard that. I'm intrigued :)

Yogurt! Antibiotics kill all the good bacteria in your tummy and digestive tract (hence the diarrhea and what not) so try something with probiotics in it. You can also just buy some probiotic pills at your pharmacy. But don't be scared to eat! It will help immensely and you'll just feel more sick if you don't. At least Z-packs are only 5 days, you'll be finished with it before you know it :)

If it bothers you enough to post here, might be best to get it checked out. Could be nothing, but better to be safe than sorry since there's a family history of HBP. My fianc was having the same issue and was put on a 48 hour holter monitor, which ruled out most conditions, and we later found out he was having issues with anxiety. Best of luck!

I'm kinda having one of those days/nights too. I've been pretty constipated for a couple if days and things finally started moving after I ate some soup but now it's making me all crampy and uncomfortable :/ You can never win with IBS.

Sorry, I'm a little late on this LOL I was incredibly morbid, I talked about death a lot, I never slept, I ran out in front of cars just to see if I could dodge them and feel the adrenaline rush (I was actually hit by a van when I was 6 and fractured my skull), I never slept, I had incredibly violent tantrums, I saw and heard things that weren't there and even talked to them. Looking back on everything, I can honestly compare it to my manic episodes as a teenager and adult and it all feels the same to me. I've never known anything aside from constantly being manic or constantly being depressed. There's rarely been any stability.

Oh no, I'm sorry to hear you're still dealing with that :( I feel lucky in the regard that I have pretty much no gag reflex. But, when they do it, tell them they need to be incredibly quick. Just focus on something else around the room and not your throat or gagging. Once they do it, take a deep breath, just relax, take solace in the fact it was over in the blink of an eye, and drink some water. The quicker they do it, the better. I've had some super quick strep tests and I barely felt it cause it was so fast. Flu swabs in the nose actually bother me more than strep tests, haha. If you really really don't want to attempt it, I agree with /u/johnnyodyssey, strep is pretty easy to spot and I think your case warrants a round of antibiotics by now. Two weeks is about how long they tell you to wait and to see your doctor if it persists. I really hope you feel better and wish you the best of luck! :)
^agree. Sounds like hypothyroidism

You had buffalo chicken and fruit juice, yeah, that'll happen. I ate one cupcake with blue frosting and my poop was blue and green for a good day or so. If you're not having any pain or feeling sick, you're fine. Just let it pass and get out if your system.
Yeah, you need to see a doctor. You can't live with diarrhea like that and if it were just something you picked up, like a virus, it should be letting up by now. Drink plenty of water.
"I cured my tourettes without medicine, you don't need medicine, you're fine. Have some motivation."
Make an appointment with your GP. It could be a number of things but it's best to consult a doctor and get it taken care of before it gets out of hand.
Have your gallbladder checked.

By the time I was 5 or 6 my parents knew. They had to dose me with Dimetap to make me sleep and I remember doing, saying, and thinking things that were not normal for a child. I can't remember a time in my life that felt 'normal', even throughout my childhood.

That is literally what happened when I smoked a strain of indica, I thought I was just a huge lightweight and maybe smoked too much. I was still high when I woke up the next day too :( I'll just stick to my meds for when I need them lol but hey, at least you can't say you didn't try! :)

May I ask which strain you tried? Indica, sativa, hybrid, they all have such different effects and I've been told indica is the best for nausea, appetite, and anxiety. But in all honesty, this is the exact reason I'm scared to try to smoke again. That is exactly what happened to me last time and I didn't enjoy it one bit.
It really might be your gallbladder. Any nausea or vomiting? How bad is the pain? Does it radiate? Any heartburn or indigestion?

I think of death quite often, actually. Not like, always suicidal or anything like that but I'm fascinated with it. Before my life went to shit I had plans to go to college for mortuary science. I'm the odd one out of all our friends, I'm morbid. I tend to think of what death is actually like. What it feels like to die certain ways, what's the last thing you hear or see, is it like going to sleep and never waking up? Is there an afterlife? Is that really it? You're not the only one :)

I only asked because you gave no specifics. I'm from the US and have been in your shoes many times in the past year, I empathize. I never heard of any alternatives to a liver biopsy, since it's so specific and probably the only way you're going to get a clear cut answer. I'd keep trying until you found a doctor to listen to you, your concern is warranted. Don't waste your time on doctors who give you the run around on something like this. Best of luck, I hope you have some success.
